page.title: 04HOW THE TOWN HAS CHANGED
page.content: Middlesbrough has changed a lot since 1830. The population has risen considerably, an the town has moved outwards to house all the people. A new, bigger town hall has been built. The council first built lots of houses near the town. When even more people came they had to knock the houses down to build shops. There are three main shopping arcades now. Transport has changed a lot. There are now deisel trains that can go very fast.Toll booths that used to be on many of the towns roads have now been abolished, and more and more people own cars.There is a big, new bus station too.
